remarks: Induction on the integers from ` M ` to ` N ` inclusive.  The first four hypotheses give us the substitution instances we need; the last two are the basis and the induction step.  Version of ~ fzind using integer range definitions.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Feb-2016.)
statement:
fzind2.1 $e |- ( x = M -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
fzind2.2 $e |- ( x = y -> ( ph <-> ch ) ) $.
fzind2.3 $e |- ( x = ( y + 1 ) -> ( ph <-> th ) ) $.
fzind2.4 $e |- ( x = K -> ( ph <-> ta ) ) $.
fzind2.5 $e |- ( N e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) -> ps ) $.
fzind2.6 $e |- ( y e. ( M ..^ N ) -> ( ch -> th ) ) $.
fzind2 $p |- ( K e. ( M ... N ) -> ta ) $.
$d K x $.
$d M x y $.
$d N x y $.
$d ch x $.
$d ph y $.
$d ps x $.
$d ta x $.
$d th x $.
